panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2A - This query returns the daily hosts
-- Memory and Usage Peaks over time.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Average Memory Usage",
    MEM_Peak AS "Average Memory Peaks"
FROM (
    -- Hosts Max and Average Memory Usage Peaks
    SELECT
        history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                memory_usage_percent,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                max_memory_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Peak
    FROM
        (
             SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
             UNION
             SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active hosts only
        hourly_daily.host_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
        AND hourly_daily.host_id in ($host_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    GROUP BY
        history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    a.time,
    MEM_Usage,
    MEM_Peak
ORDER BY
    a.time

panels.title: Average Memory Usage and Peaks(Over Time) (BR2A)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2A - This query returns the hourly and daily hosts
-- CPU Usage and Peaks over time

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    CPU_Usage,
    CPU_Peak
FROM (
    -- Here we get the hosts Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
    SELECT
        history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                cpu_usage_percent,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                max_cpu_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Peak
    FROM
        (
             SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
             UNION
             SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active hosts only
        hourly_daily.host_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
        AND hourly_daily.host_id in ($host_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    GROUP BY
        history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    a.time,
    CPU_Usage,
    CPU_Peak
ORDER BY
   a.time

panels.title: Average CPU Usage and Peaks(Over Time) (BR2A)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2A - This query returns top 5 busiest
-- Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates, over time

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    COALESCE (
        interface_name,
        MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition by 1 ),
        ''
    ) AS interface_name,
    Rx_rate AS "Avg. Receive Rate",
    Tx_rate AS "Avg. Transmite Rate"
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
            ELSE
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ||
                '*'
        END AS interface_name,
        statistics.history_datetime AS time,
        AVG (
            COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 )
        ) AS Rx_rate,
        AVG (
            COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 )
        ) AS Tx_rate
    FROM
        (
             SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
             UNION
             SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS statistics
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                statistics.host_interface_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id in ($host_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
            GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
        )
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
            GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
        )
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id IN (
            SELECT c.host_interface_id
            FROM
                (
                    SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                    UNION
                    SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                ) AS b
                INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                    ON ( c.host_interface_id = b.host_interface_id )
                INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                 SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                 UNION
                                 SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                            ) AS hourly_daily
                    ON (
                        hourly_daily.history_datetime =
                        b.history_datetime AND
                        hourly_daily.host_id in ($host_id)
                    )
            WHERE
                -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                AND c.host_id in ($host_id)
                AND c.history_id IN (
                    SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                    GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                AND
                    CASE
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                      THEN 1=1
                      WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                      THEN delete_date isnull
                    END
            GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
            ORDER BY
                AVG (
                    COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 )
                ) +
                AVG (
                    COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 )
                ) DESC
            LIMIT 5
        )
        -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
        -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
        interface_name,
        statistics.history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    a.time,
    interface_name,
    Rx_rate,
    Tx_rate
ORDER BY a.time

panels.title: Top 5 Busiest Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates (Over Time) (BR2A)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2A - This query returns the hourly hosts
-- Active VMs Counts over time

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(a.time),
    CAST ( VMS AS int ) AS "Avg. Number of Vitual Machines",
    CAST ( VMS_Peak AS int ) AS "Avg. Peaks of Number of Vitual Machines"
FROM (
    -- Here we get the hosts Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
    SELECT
        history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                active_vms,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS VMS,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                max_active_vms,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS VMS_Peak
    -- If "Period" equals to "Daily" then "table_name" parameter
    -- equals to "hourly" else "daily"
    FROM
        (
             SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
             UNION
             SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active hosts only
        hourly_daily.host_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
        AND hourly_daily.host_id in ($host_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    GROUP BY
        history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    a.time,
    VMS,
    VMS_Peak
ORDER BY
    a.time

panels.title: Average Number of Virtual Machines and Peaks (Over Time) (BR2A)
